settings.managingAppData.title: Managing App Data
settings.managingAppData.exportDataToJso: Export App Data To JSON File
settings.managingAppData.dialogs.importD: Existing data stored locally in the app will be erased and replaced by data from the JSON file. The update will be reflected on the Prior2Do Sync server upon the next connection to the server. Do you confirm importing data from a JSON file?
Existing data in the app will be erased and replaced by data from the JSON file. Do you confirm importing data from a JSON file?
settings.managingAppData.dialogs.exportD: Only task data stored locally in the app will be exported as a JSON file. Please make sure you fetch the latest task data from the Prior2Do server before exporting the data from the app. Do you confirm doing so?
Existing task data stored in the app will be exported as a JSON file. Do you confirm doing so?
settings.managingAppData.dialogs.cleanup: All tasks stored locally in the app marked as "completed" will be deleted and cannot be recovered. The update will be reflected on the Prior2Do Sync server upon the next connection to the server. Do you confirm doing so?
All tasks that are marked as "completed" will be deleted and cannot be recovered. Do you confirm doing so?
settings.managingAppData.dialogs.deleteA: EVERYTHING IN THE APP WILL BE DELETED AND CANNOT BE RECOVERED. The app would be reset to its initial state. Do you confirm doing so?
settings.appSettings.title: App Settings
settings.prior2DoSync.alert.title: Self-hosting required for Prior2Do Sync
settings.prior2DoSync.alert.message.preS: In order to enjoy the backup and sync feature, you need to
settings.prior2DoSync.alert.message.stro: host your own Prior2Do Sync server
settings.prior2DoSync.alert.message.post: and configure the app to connect to it. You can still use the app standalone if you do not have or cannot host your own Prior2Do Sync server
settings.prior2DoSync.dialogs.setServerA: Please enter an IP address/domain name that allows you to access your server EXTERNALLY. Please specify the port (e.g. XX.XX.XX.XX:8080) if your server is not serving at the default HTTP/HTTPS port.
